faq.question: What is the tax-free income limit in Bangladesh?
faq.answer: For the 2025-26 assessment year, the general tax-free income threshold is BDT 3,50,000 annually. This limit varies for women, senior citizens, and persons with disabilities.

faq.question: Is it mandatory to file a tax return if I have a TIN?
faq.answer: Yes. If you hold a TIN, you are required to file an annual tax return regardless of whether your income exceeds the tax-free threshold.

faq.question: Can you file my return online?
faq.answer: Absolutely. We handle the entire NBR e-return submission process online—you don't need to visit any tax office.

faq.question: What happens if I miss the filing deadline?
faq.answer: Late filing may result in penalties and interest charges. We ensure timely submission so you avoid additional costs.

faq.question: Do I need to show proof of assets and investments?
faq.answer: Yes. Your tax return includes an asset & liability statement. We help you prepare this accurately with the required supporting documents.
